intro: Kunzea preissiana var. villiceps, commonly known as the silky kunzea, is a shrub native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, silvery-green leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers during the cooler months, typically from June to August. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal heathlands and sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
